00019 /** Macro to increment index.
00020     Index is incremented by count; if the sum exceeds
00021     max, index is wrapped-around to the start.
00022 */
00023 #define INCR_INDEX(index, count, max)             \
00024         if(((index)+(count)) >= (max))            \
00025             index = ((index)+(count))-(max);      \
00026         else                                      \
00027             index += (count);
00028 
00029 
00030 #define INCR_INDEX_BY1(index, max)                \
00031         if((++(index)) == (max))  index=0;        \
00032 
00033 
00034 
00035 #define DECR_INDEX(index, count, max)             \
00036         if( (count) > (index) )                   \
00037            index = ( (max) - ((count - index)) ); \
00038         else                                      \
00039            index -=count;

00042 /** Structure used by core driver to send indication that the Octeon
00043     application is ready.*/
00044 typedef struct {
00045 
00046     uint64_t          corefreq;
00047 
00048 } octeon_core_setup_t;

00053 /*---------------------------  SCATTER GATHER ENTRY  -----------------------*/
00054 
00055 
00056 /** Enum differentiates whether a given scatter-gather component should
00057     be used as a gather or a scatter list. */
00058 typedef enum {
00059     OCTEON_SCATTER_LIST=0,
00060     OCTEON_GATHER_LIST=1
00061 }OCTEON_SG_LIST_TYPE;
00062 
00063 
00064 #define SCATTER_HEADER_BYTES   16
00065 
00066 
00067 
00068 /** The Scatter-Gather List Entry. The scatter or gather component used with
00069     a Octeon input instruction has this format. */
00070 typedef struct { 
00071 
00072     /** The first 64 bit gives the size of data in each dptr.*/
00073     union {
00074         uint16_t  size[4];
00075         uint64_t  size64;
00076     } u;
00077     
00078     /** The 4 dptr pointers for this entry. */
00079     uint64_t     ptr[4];
00080 
00081 }octeon_sg_entry_t;
00082 
00083 #define OCT_SG_ENTRY_SIZE    (sizeof(octeon_sg_entry_t))
00084 
00085 
00086 
00087 static inline void
00088 CAVIUM_ADD_SG_SIZE(octeon_sg_entry_t  *sg_entry,  uint16_t  size, int pos)
00089 {
00090 #if  __CAVIUM_BYTE_ORDER == __CAVIUM_BIG_ENDIAN
00091     sg_entry->u.size[pos] = size;
00092 #else
00093     sg_entry->u.size[3-pos] = size;
00094 #endif
00095 }
00096 
00097 
00098 
00099 static inline uint16_t
00100 CAVIUM_GET_SG_SIZE(octeon_sg_entry_t  *sg_entry,  int pos)
00101 {
00102 #if  __CAVIUM_BYTE_ORDER == __CAVIUM_BIG_ENDIAN
00103     return sg_entry->u.size[pos];
00104 #else
00105     return sg_entry->u.size[3-pos];
00106 #endif
00107 }
00108 
00109 /*------------------------- End Scatter/Gather ---------------------------*/

00119 /** Octeon core address range summary. */
00120 typedef struct {
00121   uint64_t    start;  /**< Range starts at this address. */
00122   uint64_t    end;    /**< Range ends at this address. */
00123 } oct_range_val_t;
00124 
00125 #define OCT_RANGE_VAL_SIZE     (sizeof(oct_range_val_t))
00126 
00127 
00128 
00129 /** Response format for a CORE_MEM_MAP instruction.
00130     The core presents the address ranges to be mapped to PCI
00131     BAR1 in this structure. */
00132 typedef  struct {
00133 
00134   uint64_t    range_count;  /**< Number of distinct Core addr ranges to map */
00135   union {
00136      oct_range_val_t   *ranges;  /**< Address ranges. */
00137      uint64_t          u64;
00138   } u;
00139 } oct_dev_range_t;
00140 
00141 
00142 #define  OCT_DEV_RANGE_SIZE    (sizeof(oct_dev_range_t))
00143

00153 /** Structure used by host driver to pass PCI address map of all Octeon
00154     devices. For each octeon device, one instance of this structure is used. */
00155 typedef struct {
00156 
00157     /** Device Id of Octeon device to which this map belongs. */
00158     uint64_t             octeon_id;
00159 
00160     /** BAR0 PCI mapped address for this Octeon device. */
00161     uint64_t             bar0_pci_addr;
00162 
00163     /** BAR1 PCI mapped address for this Octeon device. */
00164     uint64_t             bar1_pci_addr;
00165 
00166 } cn56xx_pci_map_t;
00167 
00168 
00169 
00170 
00171 
00172 /** Structure used by host driver to send identifying information to each Octeon
00173     device. used in endpoint-communication. */
00174 typedef struct {
00175 
00176     /** This Octeon's device id. */
00177     uint8_t              my_device_id;
00178 
00179     /** Total number of Octeon devices in the system. */
00180     uint8_t              dev_count;
00181 
00182     /** Swap mode to be used when sending instruction to another endpoint. */
00183     uint8_t              swap_mode;
00184 
00185     uint8_t              reserved[5];
00186 
00187 } cn56xx_pci_map_hdr_t;
00188 
00189 
00190 
00191 
00192 /** Structure used when host driver sets up endpoint-to-endpoint communication
00193     between multiple CN56XX devices. */
00194 typedef struct {
00195 
00196     cn56xx_pci_map_hdr_t hdr;
00197     cn56xx_pci_map_t     map;
00198 
00199 } cn56xx_map_data_t;
00200
